text: Abdullo Rakhimbayev Abdullo Rahimbayevich Rakhimbayev (June 1, 1896 – May 7, 1938) also spelled Abdullo Raximboyevich Raximboyev, was an ethnic Uzbek, Tajik-born Soviet politician. He was born in Khujand in modern Tajikistan. He was a recipient of the Order of Lenin. He served on the Central Executive Committee of the Soviet Union as representative of the Tajik Soviet Socialist Republic from January 1934 to September 1937. He was arrested and executed during the Great Purge. After the death of Joseph Stalin, he was rehabilitated. ==References== Category:1896 births Category:1938 deaths Category:Uzbek revolutionaries Category:Recipients of the Order of Lenin Category:People from Khujand Category:People from Samarkand Oblast Category:Great Purge victims from Tajikistan Category:People executed by the Soviet Union Category:Soviet rehabilitations
title: Abdullo Rakhimbayev
